Tasks.Task Description: Gather requirements for the Azure Blob Storage setup, including data types, expected volume, access patterns, and security needs.
Create a new Azure Storage account in the Azure portal. Ensure to select the appropriate performance and replication options based on requirements.
Set up access policies for the storage account, including role-based access control (RBAC) to ensure proper permissions for users and applications.
Create a blob container within the storage account to organize and manage blobs. Define access levels (private, blob, container) as needed.
Determine the method for migrating existing data to Azure Blob Storage, such as using AzCopy, Azure Data Factory, or Data Box.
Enable encryption at rest and in transit for the storage account. Configure firewall rules and virtual network service endpoints as necessary.
Create storage tasks to automate operations on blobs, such as moving data between tiers or applying policies.
Set up monitoring for the storage account using Azure Monitor. Configure alerts for performance metrics and access logs.
Conduct tests to ensure data can be accessed as expected and that performance meets requirements. Validate security configurations.
Document the setup process, configurations, and operational procedures. Provide training for the team on managing Azure Blob Storage.
Ensure the storage setup complies with relevant regulations. Implement auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
